channel.title: Deep Learning for Spatial and Spatio-Temporal Statistics
channel.description: Recent content on Deep Learning for Spatial and Spatio-Temporal Statistics

item.title: Contact
item.description: For more information on the project, please contact me using any of the below: Address: School of Mathematics and Applied Statistics, University of Wollongong NSW 2522, Australia E-mail: azm [at] uow.edu.au Twitter: @andrewzm Phone: +61 0242215112 If you would like to keep up to date with my research, please subscribe to the blog on my personal web page.

item.title: Publications
item.description: The following is a list of publications on work that was partially or fully supported by Australian Research Council (ARC) Discovery Early Career Research Award (DECRA) DE180100203. 2022 T.L.J. Ng and A. Zammit-Mangion (2022), “Non-homogeneous Poisson process intensity modelling and estimation using measure transport,” in press with Bernoulli. C.K. Wikle and A. Zammit-Mangion, “Statistical Deep Learning for Spatial and Spatio-Temporal Data,” in press with Annual Review of Statistics and Its Application.

item.title: Collaborators and Students
item.description:
Collaborators Noel Cressie Distinguished Professor at the University of Wollongong, Australia
Nicholas Deutscher Senior Research Fellow at the University of Wollongong, Australia
Maurizio Filippone AXA Chair of Computational Statistics and Associate Professor at EURECOM, France
Raphaël Huser Assistant Professor at the King Abdullah University of Science and Technology, Saudi Arabia

item.title: Workshop on Statistical Deep Learning
item.description: When: 24-25 October 2022 Where: Sydney Business School Level 10, 1 Macquarie Place, Sydney Price: Free About: This workshop aims to bring together researchers in the region that are interested in topics at the interface of deep learning and statistics. It will be based around a set of talks, and there will be time for discussion and networking between the talks. The workshop is 1.5 days long, and will finish at noon on the 25th October.
